description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration

1. Number of meetings of inter-ministerial committee on social protection that strengthened policy advocacy, coordination, monitoring and evaluation and reporting of social protection 2. Number of nationally authored research reports for evidence based policy development 3. National Social Security Strategy (NSSS) approved by Cabinet [Scale 0-2; 1 for Drafted, 2 for Approved] 4. 4. National Social Security Strategy (NSSS) Implementation Action Plan Approved [Scale 0-2; 1 for Drafted, 2 for Approved] 5. Strong national and international network and linkages built by organizing number of conferences, workshops and seminars held by the government on national social security as a result of UNDP's intervention
Strengthening Women’s Ability for Productive New Opportunities
Strengthening Women’s Ability for Productive New Opportunities
policy, planning and administration

1. Number of rural extreme poor women employed [Project operational in 2015] 2. Percentage of beneficiary children 0 - 5 years old with complete immunizations [Project operational in 2015] 3. Percentage of beneficiary women with improved health status (self-reported) as against baseline status [Project operational in 2015] 4. Number of people with access to improved economic infrastructure (roads, markets, etc.) as a result of public works completed through the project [Project operational in 2015] 5. Percentage of local government institutions sensitive to inclusiveness (including gender aspects) and able to make pro-poor plans [Project operational in 2015]

The project will allow the National Ozone Unit of Department of Environment for the implementation of Bangladesh’s strategy in areas related to the Phase-out of Ozone Depleting Substances under the Montreal Protocol.
